intro: Salsola monandra, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that help it survive drought conditions. Salsola monandra is often considered a weed in agricultural areas due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
